info.description:
## Welcome To The Ziflow API 
 The Ziflow API is built to allow you to easily and quickly embed Ziflow’s proofing features in your own application or create an integration between Ziflow and any other application. This API is the same one we use to power Ziflow! 
 The API is a RESTful interface, essentially providing programmatic access to the features and data in the system. If you’ve interacted with a RESTful API before, many of the concepts will be familiar - it provides predictable URLs for accessing resources and uses built-in HTTP features. 
  The API accepts JSON or form-encoded content in requests and returns JSON content in all of its responses, including errors. Only the UTF-8 character encoding is supported for both requests and responses.
  ### Base domain 
 API calls to Ziflow should be made to the https://api.ziflow.io/v1 . 
  ### Security & Authentication 
 The Ziflow API is an SSL-only API. You must be a verified user to make API requests. Ziflow currently supports basic authentication using an API token. The API token can be found on your “Contact details” page - you can access this page by clicking on your avatar in the top right when logged in to the application.
info.title: Ziflow API

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of proofs with a maximum of 100 proofs. It returns the latest version the user making the API call can see. A list is sorted from the newest to the oldest proofs. 
 Returns array of proof object

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specifies number of records to return with max=100

post.description:
Creates a new proof, version or batch of proofs in Ziflow with a simple HTTP POST. 
  The POST body must include: 
 * At least one URL(s) to a file or a website page. We currently support downloading files using HTTP/HTTPS and S3 also with parametrized URL.  You may also specify a URL for live website or web capturing by including the type: 'web-interactive' or 'web-static'. 
 * At least one stage with member that must be the owner of the proof. 
 The proof will be created immediately and start processing. Once processed reviewers will be notified. 
 
 Returns proof_id in response body. 
 
 Lock and stage_trigger (except deadline object) can be edited only on Enterprise edition. 
 In case lock type - next_stage_starts, parent stage can be defined only by unique stage_name. 
 In trigger object parent_stage can be defined only by unique stage_name

get.description: Returns information about a single proof version.

put.description:
A specific, existing proof can be updated by making a PUT request on the URL for that proof. Only the fields provided in the data block will be updated; any unspecified fields will remain unchanged. 
 
 ### Helpful tips: 
 * It is best to specify only those fields you wish to change. 
  * When working with Stages and Members you are able to pass in only the id, which means we'll leave that object unchanged. This is useful when adding or deleting Stages or Members on the proof. 
 Returns the complete updated proof record. 
 
 Lock and stage_trigger (except deadline object) can be edited only on Enterprise edition. 
 In case lock type - next_stage_starts, parent stage can be defined only by stage_id. 
 In trigger object parent_stage can be defined only by stage_id

post.description:
Reviewer id is optional. 
 Either decision or completed must be provided dependent on user's review permissions

put.description:
Reviewer id is optional. 
 Either decision or completed must be provided dependent on user's review permissions

get.description: Returns information about a specific user in the account.

delete.description:
A specific, existing proof can be deleted by making a DELETE request on the URL for that proof. 
 Returns empty data record

get.description: Returns information about a specific contact in the account.
Returns list of all comments for a specific proof.

post.description: Returns list of all comments for a specific proof.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Pet object that needs to be added to the store

post.description:
Creates a new subscription with a simple HTTP POST. 
 Can be performed only by user with Admin rights.

delete.description:
Deletes subscription with a simple HTTP POST. 
 Can be performed only by user with Admin rights.

get.description: ## Request to show webhook event structure.
Request available only on Enterprise edition. Can be performed only by user with admin rights.

Header API key parameter.name: apikey
Header API key parameter.description: Provide api key as header parameter named 'apikey'.

Basic HTTP authentication.description: Provide apiKey as Username and leave password empty

Query API key parameter.name: apikey
Query API key parameter.description: Provide api key as query parameter

first_name.description: For contact type 'guest' null value is also allowed

last_name.description: For contact type 'guest' null value is also allowed

roles.description: For contact 'guest' value is always null

suppress_all_emails.description: If true, Ziflow will not send any emails regarding this proof.nThe only emails that can be triggered are the emails that are sent when using the 'remind' function within the web application.

id.description: Provide id of every stage you wish to change or leave unchanged - missing stage id will be deleted.
Provide id of every stage you wish to change or leave unchanged - missing stage id will be deleted.

version_previous_id.description: If provided and the user has rights to create a new version, this proof will become the new version of the proof.

combine.description: If true the input sources are combined into one proof in the order passed through. The parameter is only available for the Business and Enterprise edition. For starter edtiton forced to false

suppress_all_emails.description: If true, Ziflow will not send any emails regarding this proof.nThe only emails that can be triggered are the emails that are sent when using the 'remind' function within the web application.

status.description: The overall status of the proof

decision_status.description: The overall proof status calculated from all the stages

download_link.description: null or URL to download the source file(s)

suppress_all_emails.description: If true, Ziflow will not send any emails regarding this proof.nThe only emails that can be triggered are the emails that are sent when using the 'remind' function within the web application.

source.description: URL to proof file, can be parametrized

id.description: Available only on Enterprise edition. Id of an active template required to create proof from template

deadline.description: Deadline date and time calculated when stage starts i.e. '2012-02-22T02:00:00.000Z'

status.description: The overall proof status calculated from all the reviewer's decisions

time.description: Time in UTC, required only if days=0 and has to be at least 1 hour ahead from stage start

proof_url.description: Visible only to admin and proof owner

Location.description: For static proof provide page number, for audio and video - start time

comment.example: We should change background color for brighter one

tags.name: people
tags.description:
In Ziflow we have two type of contacts. 
 One of them are Ziflow users and second one are all the guests that might have been invited to your proofs.

tags.name: proofs
tags.description:
Proofs are one of the fundamental building blocks of Ziflow. 
 It is important to note the distinction between how proofs are represented within the application vs the API: 
  * Application: only the latest version of a proof visible to a logged in the user is displayed - if a proof has 4 versions, the user would see v4 with v1 to v3 sitting “behind” this latest version. 
 * API: each version is its own proof object and versions are linked by use of a parent ID, thereby creating a linked list of proof objects.

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks allows you to subscribe to changes and be notified of these changes as and when they occur. 
 Webhooks are basically an easy way to receive notification of changes (Events) via an HTTP POST instead of polling for them. For services accessible via HTTP this is vastly more convenient and efficient. 
 
 Ziflow currently sends one Event object per POST. We will later on extend this and send arrays of Event objects per POST which should be handled by the target.
